intro: Palicourea apiculata, commonly known as the Brazilian jasmine or white palicourea, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its fragrant white flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Palicourea apiculata is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in folk medicine.
